words.example: Do is an auxiliary verb in questions.

Without is a preposition.

words.example: Don't waste food.
They have a smart garden system.

patterns.meaning: 越来越……
patterns.example: Protecting the environment becomes more and more important.

patterns.pattern: when + 主语 + 动词原形, ...
patterns.meaning: 当……时候，……（时间状语从句用一般现在时表达习惯/规律）
patterns.example: When we leave home, we turn off the light.

patterns.pattern: If + 一般现在时, will + 动词原形
patterns.meaning: 如果……，将会……（条件句）
patterns.example: If everyone does it, the environment will be better.

patterns.meaning: 应该……（建议/倡议语气）
patterns.example: We should protect the environment.

patterns.meaning: 告诉某人去做某事
patterns.example: He told me to save energy.

patterns.pattern: It is + adj. + for sb + to do sth
patterns.meaning: 对某人来说做某事是……的
patterns.example: It is better for us to save energy.

patterns.meaning: 强调句：强调句子中的某一部分
patterns.example: It is the environment that we should protect.

patterns.meaning: 做某事的方法/方式
patterns.example: Ways of protecting the environment are discussed in the essay.

patterns.meaning: 现在完成时结构：表示“已经……/做过……”
patterns.example: I have already done my homework.

patterns.meaning: 被动语态结构：表示“被……”
patterns.example: The apple is eaten by me.

patterns.meaning: 过去分词作形容词：表示“被……的”
patterns.example: the eaten apple

patterns.meaning: say后接从句表达“说/表示……（内容）”
patterns.example: He said (that) it would rain.

patterns.meaning: speak后接语言：表示“会说某种语言”
patterns.example: She speaks English.

patterns.pattern: It is + adj. + for + noun + to do
patterns.meaning: 对……来说做……是……的（常用于书面表达）
patterns.example: It is essential for a successful experiment to have proper preparation.

patterns.pattern: It is + adj. + to do sth
patterns.meaning: 做某事是……的（可用于表达评价/感受）
patterns.example: It is surprising to see such a little boy speak so fluently.

patterns.meaning: 看见某人做了某事（从头到尾/完整动作）
patterns.example: I saw him speak in class.

patterns.meaning: 看见某人正在做某事（强调当时正在进行）
patterns.example: I saw him speaking to the teacher.

patterns.meaning: 邀请某人做某事
patterns.example: They invited me to join the club.

patterns.meaning: 在网站上分享某物
patterns.example: They shared their ideas on a website.

patterns.meaning: without后接名词或动名词
patterns.example: He left without saying goodbye.

patterns.meaning: 邀请/要求某人去做某事
patterns.example: They asked us to be quiet.

patterns.meaning: 介词后接动名词（V-ing）
patterns.example: without saying goodbye

patterns.pattern: Do/Does/Did + 主语 + 动词原形 ... ?
patterns.meaning: 一般疑问句结构（无be/情态/助动词时）
patterns.example: Do you like English?

patterns.pattern: 主语 + do/does/did + not + 动词原形
patterns.meaning: 否定句结构（无be/情态/助动词时）
patterns.example: He does not like milk.

patterns.meaning: grow的不规则变化：生长（过去式/过去分词）
patterns.example: The plant grew fast and has grown tall.

patterns.meaning: without后接动名词，用于合并句子表达“在不……的情况下”
patterns.example: They cook meals without wasting any food.

patterns.meaning: and连接两个并列分句
patterns.example: They can cook meals and they never waste any food.

patterns.meaning: 表达“做……是可能的/可以的”
patterns.example: It is possible to cook meals without wasting food.

patterns.meaning: the+形容词表示“一类人”
patterns.example: The rich live differently from the poor.

patterns.meaning: 名词 + that从句（定语从句，修饰前面的名词）
patterns.example: families that are not rich

patterns.meaning: 动词 + that从句（宾语从句，that引导从句作宾语）
patterns.example: We know that Jason is eighteen.

patterns.pattern: WH-word + do/does + 主语 + 动词原形
patterns.meaning: 对宾语提问的特殊疑问句结构
patterns.example: What does he teach people?

patterns.meaning: 做某事有困难（in可省略）
patterns.example: Kids have trouble (in) reading.

patterns.meaning: 名词 + 介词短语作后置定语
patterns.example: the kids in trouble

patterns.meaning: 动名词短语作主语
patterns.example: Reading books makes people better.

patterns.meaning: 动名词短语作主语视为单数，谓语用三单
patterns.example: Reading books makes progress.

grammar.title: 介词 to 与 for：动作是否“到达/给到”对方
grammar.definition: 表达“把某物给某人、某物到某人手上”常用 to；表达“为某人做某事/买东西（受益者）”常用 for。
grammar.structure: give/pass/send + 物 + to + 人；buy/make + 物 + for + 人
usage: I gave the book to him.（书交到他手上）
I bought a book for him.（为他买书，强调受益者，不一定已交到他手上）
也可用 buy + 物 + and give it to + 人 来表达“买了并且给到了”

mistakes.wrong: I bought a book to you.
mistakes.correct: I bought a book for you. / I bought a book and gave it to you.
mistakes.explanation: buy 表“为某人买”通常搭配 for；to 更像“交付给”。

examples: This is important to everyone.
I bought a book for you yesterday, and I gave it to you today.

grammar.title: 动名词作主语：Protecting the environment ...
grammar.definition: 动词要作句子主语时，常用动名词（V-ing）把动作“名词化”，把它当作“一件事”。
grammar.structure: V-ing + ... + 谓语动词 + ...
usage: Protecting the environment becomes important.（“保护环境”这件事作主语）
动名词短语作主语时通常看作单数概念

mistakes.explanation: 主语位置不能直接用动词原形表达“这件事”，要用动名词或不定式结构。

examples: Protecting the environment becomes more and more important.
Saving energy is important to us.

grammar.title: 主谓一致：动名词短语作主语通常用单数谓语
grammar.definition: 当主语是“Protecting the environment”这类动名词短语时，整体当作一件事，谓语动词用第三人称单数。
grammar.structure: 动名词短语（单数概念） + becomes/is/has ...
usage: Protecting the environment becomes ...（becomes加-s）
If everyone does it, ...（everyone作主语也用单数does）

mistakes.wrong: Protecting the environment become more important.
mistakes.correct: Protecting the environment becomes more important.
mistakes.explanation: 主语是“这件事”，按单数处理。

examples: Protecting the environment becomes more and more important.
Everyone does their part.

grammar.title: “越来越……”：more and more + 形容词
grammar.definition: 表达程度逐渐增强，常用 more and more + 形容词（或比较级形式）。
grammar.structure: be/become + more and more + adj.
usage: more and more important（越来越重要）
more and more serious（越来越严重）

mistakes.wrong: It becomes more important. (想表达越来越)
mistakes.correct: It becomes more and more important.
mistakes.explanation: more important通常表示“更重要（比较）”，不等于“越来越”。

examples: The environment is getting worse day by day.
Protecting the environment becomes more and more important.

grammar.title: 避免逗号拼接（comma splice）：两句话需要连接词或分句结构
grammar.definition: 英语里两个完整的独立句不能只用逗号连接；需要并列连词（and/but/so）或改为从句/分号等。
grammar.structure: 句子A, and/but/so 句子B；或 句子A. 句子B.
usage: We should protect the environment, and it can make our life better.
We should protect the environment. It can make our life better.

mistakes.wrong: We should protect the environment, make our life better.
mistakes.correct: We should protect the environment, and it can make our life better.
mistakes.explanation: 后半句缺主语且与前句只用逗号硬连，结构不完整。

examples: We can save energy, and we can also plant trees.
First, we can save energy. Second, we can plant trees.

grammar.title: 句子必须有主语：必要时用 it 指代前文整件事
grammar.definition: 英语句子里谓语动词通常需要明确主语；当指代前面“整件事/整段内容”可用 it 作形式主语或代词主语。
grammar.structure: It + 谓语 + ...（it指代前文内容）
usage: We should protect the environment, and it can make our life better.（it=保护环境这件事）
If everyone does it, the environment will be better.（it=前面提到的做法）

mistakes.wrong: Second, can also plant some trees.
mistakes.correct: Second, we can also plant some trees.
mistakes.explanation: 缺少主语 we。

examples: It is important to everyone.
It can make our life better.

grammar.title: when 引导时间状语从句：不用进行时乱入
grammar.definition: 表达习惯性/一般情况时，when从句常用一般现在时；不要直接用“when + 主语 + going ...”这种缺少be动词的结构。
grammar.structure: when + 主语 + 动词原形/三单, 主句 + ...
usage: When we leave home, we turn off the light.
When we go out, we can walk or ride a bike.

mistakes.wrong: When we going out, we choose walk.
mistakes.correct: When we go out, we choose to walk.
mistakes.explanation: going前缺少be；且一般情况用go out即可。

examples: When we leave home, we turn off the light.
When we go out, we choose to walk.

grammar.title: 作文建议语气：should vs can
grammar.definition: 提出倡议/建议时，should更有“应该”的力度；can更偏“能够/可以”，语气更客气、弱一些。
grammar.structure: We should + 动词原形；We can + 动词原形
usage: 强建议/号召：We should protect the environment.
举例/可行做法：For example, we can turn off the light.

mistakes.wrong: We can protect the environment. (整段在号召时一直用can)
mistakes.correct: We should protect the environment. For example, we can turn off the light.
mistakes.explanation: 主张用should更符合“提倡”；举例措施再用can。

examples: We should protect the environment.
For example, we can plant trees.

grammar.title: 代词指代一致：it / this / them
grammar.definition: it 通常指代单个事物或前文“一件事”；them 指代复数名词；this 可指代“这一点/这件事（更贴近语境）”。
grammar.structure: it=单数/一件事；them=复数名词；this=这一点/这件事
usage: If everyone does it, the environment will be better.（it=某个做法/整件事）
We planted some trees. Everyone should protect them.（them=trees）
Everyone can do this.（this=这个做法/这件事）

mistakes.wrong: Second... plant some trees... If everyone can do it, ... (上文有多个做法却只用it不清楚)
mistakes.correct: If everyone can do this, ... / If everyone can do them, ...
mistakes.explanation: 上文若是多个措施或复数名词，要让代词指代更清晰。

examples: We can plant some trees to clean the air.
If everyone can do this, the environment will be better.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：tell / talk / speak（固定搭配与句型）
grammar.definition: 这些动词含义相近但搭配不同：tell强调“告知”；talk强调“交谈/谈论”；speak强调“说话/讲某种语言/正式发言”。
grammar.structure: tell sb to do sth；tell sb sth；tell sb (that) 从句；talk about sth；talk with/to sb；speak + 语言 / speak to sb（较正式）
usage: tell sb to do：She told me to turn off the light.
tell sb sth：He told me the news.
tell (that) clause：He told me (that) he was busy.
talk about：We talked about the environment.
talk with/to：I talked with/to my teacher.
speak English：He speaks English well.

mistakes.correct: tell sb to do sth / tell sb (that) ...
mistakes.explanation: tell后面表示“让某人去做”用to do；表示“告诉某事已发生”用that从句。

examples: She told me to plant trees.
We talked about ways to save energy.
He speaks English in class.

grammar.title: 强调句 It is/was ... that ...（写作加分句式）
grammar.definition: 用 It is/was ... that ... 强调句子中的某一部分（主语/宾语/状语等），提升写作表达。
grammar.structure: It is/was + 被强调部分 + that + 句子其余部分
usage: 强调主语：It is protecting the environment that matters most.
强调时间：It is now that we should act.

mistakes.wrong: It is better for us that save energy.
mistakes.correct: It is better for us to save energy.
mistakes.explanation: It is + adj. + for sb + to do 为常用结构；强调句需要that并保留完整句子结构。

examples: It is the environment that we should protect.
It is now that we must take action.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：say vs speak（内容 vs 方式/语言）
grammar.definition: say强调“说的内容”；speak强调“说话/交流的方式”或“讲某种语言”。
grammar.structure: say (that) + 从句 / say + 内容；speak + 语言 / speak to/with + 人
usage: say：He said it would rain.（他说：将要下雨——内容）
speak：She can speak English.（她会用英语交流——语言/方式）
若强调把某个“单词”说出来，通常用 say：Say 'English'.

mistakes.explanation: 表达“说的内容”要用say并用从句/内容承接。

mistakes.wrong: I speak English (想表达“英语这个词”).
mistakes.explanation: speak English表示“用英语说话”，不是“把English这个词念出来”。

examples: He said (that) it would rain.
She speaks English and Chinese.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：tell / talk / speak（常考固定搭配）
grammar.definition: tell强调“告知/让某人去做”；talk强调“交谈/讨论”；speak更偏正式或强调语言/说话动作。
grammar.structure: tell sb to do / tell sb sth / tell sb (that)...；talk about sth / talk with(to) sb；speak + language / speak to sb
usage: tell sb to do：He told me to study.
tell sb sth：She told me the truth.
talk about：We talked about school.
talk with/to：I talked with/to my friend.
speak English：He speaks English well.

mistakes.correct: tell sb to do sth / tell sb (that) ...
mistakes.explanation: tell表示“让某人去做”用to do；表示“告诉发生了什么”用that从句。

examples: I need to talk to you.
He told me to turn off the light.

grammar.title: 不规则动词变化与ABB/AAA分类（本段重点）
grammar.definition: 部分动词不按-ed规则变化，需要记忆过去式和过去分词；有ABB（后两者相同）、AAA（三者相同）等类型。
grammar.structure: 原形 - 过去式 - 过去分词（ABB/AAA等）
usage: ABB：tell-told-told；say-said-said
ABC：speak-spoke-spoken；do-did-done
AAA：cut-cut-cut；put-put-put；read-read-read（读音变化）；hurt-hurt-hurt；spread-spread-spread；hit-hit-hit；cost-cost-cost

mistakes.explanation: tell是不规则动词（ABB）。
speak是不规则动词（ABC）。

examples: He spoke to the class yesterday.
I have spoken to him before.

grammar.title: 一般过去时：过去式的核心用法
grammar.definition: 过去式用于描述“昨天/以前”发生并结束的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式 + 时间状语（yesterday/last week/...）
usage: I ate rice yesterday.（过去已发生并结束）
He said it would rain.（过去说过的话）

mistakes.explanation: yesterday提示一般过去时，动词要用过去式。

examples: I did my homework yesterday.
She talked with me last night.

grammar.title: 过去分词的三大用法：完成 / 被动 / 形容词
grammar.definition: 过去分词不仅用于完成时，还用于被动语态，并可像形容词一样修饰名词。
grammar.structure: ① have/has + 过去分词；② be + 过去分词；③ 过去分词 + 名词
usage: 完成：I have already done my homework.
被动：The apple is eaten by me.
形容词：the eaten apple（被吃的苹果）

mistakes.explanation: 现在完成时要用过去分词done，不用过去式did。

examples: The house is controlled by a central system.
She has spoken to the teacher.

grammar.title: 被动语态：be + 过去分词（by+动作执行者）
grammar.definition: 当主语是动作的承受者时，用被动语态；需要be动词随时态变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + be(am/is/are/was/were/been/being) + 过去分词 (+ by + 人/物)
usage: 一般现在时被动：The apple is eaten by me.
一般过去时被动：The apple was eaten by me.
完成时中的be：has/have been + 过去分词（如has been controlled）
进行时中的be：is/are being + 过去分词（如is being controlled）

mistakes.wrong: The house is control by a system.
mistakes.correct: The house is controlled by a system.
mistakes.explanation: be后必须接过去分词controlled。

examples: The house is controlled by a central system.
The rules were explained by the teacher.

grammar.title: 拼写规则：重读闭音节/英式双写（planned, controlled）
grammar.definition: 部分动词加-ed/-ing时需要双写末尾辅音；此外英式拼写中以-l结尾的动词常见双写l。
grammar.structure: plan → planned/planning；control → controlled/controlling
usage: plan：He planned the trip.
control：The machine is controlled by a system.

mistakes.explanation: plan为重读闭音节，末尾n需双写。
常见写法为controlled（双写l）。

examples: They planned a new schedule.
The room is controlled by a computer.

grammar.title: 作文选词：speech / speaker（名词意义不同）
grammar.definition: speech是“演讲/讲话（内容/活动）”；speaker是“演讲者/说话者/扬声器（人或设备）”。
grammar.structure: give/make a speech；the speaker + 谓语
usage: I gave a speech in front of the crowd.
The speaker was nervous.

mistakes.wrong: I gave a speaker in front of the crowd.
mistakes.correct: I gave a speech in front of the crowd.
mistakes.explanation: “做演讲”用speech；speaker是人/设备，不是“演讲活动”。

examples: Giving a speech can make people nervous.
The speaker prepared well.

grammar.title: 词汇辨析：experiment vs experience
grammar.definition: experiment是“实验”；experience是“经历/经验”，词形相近但意义不同。
grammar.structure: do an experiment；have experience in/with ...
usage: We did an experiment in science class.
She has experience with public speaking.

mistakes.correct: I have much experience. / I did many experiments.
mistakes.explanation: 想表达“经验”用experience；“多次实验”用experiments（复数）。

examples: Proper preparation is essential for a successful experiment.
He has rich experience.

grammar.title: 长句翻译技巧：抓介词/连词，从后往前译修饰成分
grammar.definition: 英语长句通常因介词短语、连词结构变长；翻译时先找介词/连词引出的“附加信息”，再处理主干。
grammar.structure: 主干（主谓宾） + 介词短语/从句等修饰；翻译可先译修饰：in..., for..., of..., with..., because...
usage: 先找介词短语：in science class / for a successful experiment
再译主干：proper preparation is essential
组合：在科学课上/对于一个成功的实验来说，合适的准备是必不可少的。

mistakes.wrong: 合适的准备是重要的对于一个成功的实验在科学课上。
mistakes.correct: 在科学课上，对于一个成功的实验来说，合适的准备非常重要。
mistakes.explanation: 中文语序更自然：先交代背景（介词短语），再说核心判断。

examples: Proper preparation is essential for a successful experiment in science class.
In science class, proper preparation is essential for a successful experiment.

grammar.title: 动名词作主语：V-ing整体作主语（不是介词短语作主语）
grammar.definition: 动词加-ing可名词化，作为一句话的主语；主语通常是“动名词短语整体”。
grammar.structure: V-ing + 宾语/状语（整体） + 谓语
usage: Giving a speech can make people nervous.（做演讲这件事作主语）
动名词短语整体看作“单数概念”时，谓语用单数

mistakes.wrong: In front of a crowd give a speech is nervous.
mistakes.correct: Giving a speech in front of a crowd can be nervous.
mistakes.explanation: 主语应是动名词短语（Giving a speech...），介词短语通常作修饰。

examples: Giving a speech is difficult for some people.
Preparing well is essential.

grammar.title: 介词后接什么：介词 + 名词/动名词（不是动词原形）
grammar.definition: 介词后面通常接名词或动名词；不能直接接动词原形。
grammar.structure: prep. + n. / prep. + V-ing
usage: without + V-ing：without saying goodbye
into + n.：into management
in + n.：in class

mistakes.explanation: into是介词，后面要接名词。
without后可接动名词saying。

examples: She walked into the room without knocking.
More women should enter into management.

grammar.title: 不定式 to do：两词当作一个整体（常用于目的/要求/评价）
grammar.definition: to do 是“不定式结构”，整体可作名词性/目的性成分；与动名词一样都属于“结构变化”。
grammar.structure: to + 动词原形（整体）
usage: It is surprising to see him speak so fluently.
invite/ask + sb + to do

mistakes.explanation: invite表示“邀请去做（尚未发生）”，固定搭配to do。

examples: They invited me to join the club.
The teacher asked us to be quiet.

grammar.title: It is 强调句 vs It is + adj. + to do（本段出现两种It is结构）
grammar.definition: It is...that...用于强调；It is + adj. + to do用于评价/感受（如surprising/essential）。两者结构不同。
structure: 强调句：It is/was + 被强调部分 + that + 句子其余部分
评价句：It is + adj. + to do sth / It is + adj. + for sb + to do sth
usage: 评价：It is surprising to see such a little boy speak so fluently.
强调：It is a foreign language that he speaks fluently.（强调宾语/内容）

mistakes.wrong: It is surprising that to see him...
mistakes.correct: It is surprising to see him...
mistakes.explanation: to do结构不需要that；若用that应改为从句：It is surprising that he can...

examples: It is essential for students to prepare well.
It is John that I met yesterday.

grammar.title: see 的两种宾补：see sb do vs see sb doing
grammar.definition: see sb do 强调动作完整发生（从头到尾/事实）；see sb doing 强调“正在发生”的动作片段。
grammar.structure: see + 宾语 + do / doing
usage: see sb do：I saw him speak to the crowd.（看见他做了这件事）
see sb doing：I saw him speaking to the crowd.（看见他当时正在说）

mistakes.correct: I saw him speak / I saw him speaking.
mistakes.explanation: see作感官动词，宾补不用to（主动语态）。

examples: I saw her cross the street.
I saw her crossing the street.

grammar.title: invite/ask 的固定搭配：只能接 to do（表示尚未发生的动作）
grammar.definition: invite/ask表示“邀请/要求某人去做”，通常动作未发生，因此用to do而不用doing。
grammar.structure: invite/ask + sb + to do sth
usage: invite：They invited him to give a speech.
ask：Ms. Liu asked us to be quiet.

mistakes.explanation: ask在此义项固定搭配to do。

examples: The teacher asked us to answer the question.
They invited us to share ideas on the website.

grammar.title: 称呼语用法：Mr. / Mrs. / Miss / Ms.
grammar.definition: Mr.用于男性；Mrs.用于已婚女性；Miss用于未婚女性；Ms.用于不确定或不强调婚姻状况的女性。
grammar.structure: 称呼 + 姓氏（如Ms. Liu / Mr. Lee）
usage: Mr. Lee（男老师/男士）
Mrs. Smith（已婚女士）
Miss Liu（未婚女士/女老师）
Ms. Liu（不确定/不想说明婚姻状况）

mistakes.explanation: Mr.只用于男性；女性需用Miss/Ms./Mrs.。

examples: Ms. Brown asked us to be quiet.
Mr. Wang is our math teacher.

grammar.title: to do vs to doing：不定式后永远用动词原形
grammar.definition: to do结构里to后必须接动词原形；to doing通常不成立（除非to是介词，如look forward to doing）。
grammar.structure: to + 动词原形
usage: invite/ask + sb + to do：invite him to come / ask us to be quiet
It is + adj. + to do：It is important to study

mistakes.explanation: 不定式to后接原形come。
to后接原形be。

examples: They invited me to join the club.
It is useful to learn grammar.

grammar.title: 介词后接名词或动名词：without + n./doing
grammar.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形；要接名词或动名词（V-ing）。
grammar.structure: preposition + noun / preposition + V-ing
usage: without + 名词：without money
without + V-ing：without saying anything

mistakes.explanation: without是介词，后接动名词saying。

examples: He left without saying goodbye.
She went out without an umbrella.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句改写：有be/情态/助动词就提前；没有就用do/does/did
grammar.definition: 把陈述句变一般疑问句：先看句中是否有be动词、情态动词或助动词（如have/has用于完成时）；有就把它提前；没有就在句首加do/does/did，动词变回原形。
structure: ① be/情态/助动词 + 主语 + ... ?
② Do/Does/Did + 主语 + 动词原形 + ... ?
usage: be：He is a student. → Is he a student?
情态：She can swim. → Can she swim?
完成时：They have finished. → Have they finished?
无上述：He makes cakes. → Does he make cakes?

mistakes.explanation: 用了does后，实义动词要回原形make。
主语为三单he，用does。

examples: Do you like apples?
Did she go to school yesterday?

grammar.title: 助动词do/does/did的选择：看时态与主语（三单/非三单）
grammar.definition: 一般现在时：主语是第三人称单数用does，否则用do；一般过去时用did。选择时也可看原句动词形式：三单-s→does；过去式→did；原形/非三单→do。
grammar.structure: 现在：do/does + 原形；过去：did + 原形
usage: He makes... → Does he make...?
They make... → Do they make...?
He made... → Did he make...?

mistakes.explanation: he是第三人称单数，用does；动词回原形。

examples: Does the oven tell us something?
Do they share ideas online?

grammar.title: 特殊疑问句（划线部分提问）：WH词 + 一般疑问句语序
grammar.definition: 对划线部分提问：先确定问什么（人/物/时间/地点/原因等）选择WH词；再把剩下部分变成一般疑问句语序（有助动词就提前，没有就加do/does/did）。
grammar.structure: WH-word + 助动词/系动词/情态 + 主语 + 动词原形 + ... ?
usage: 对物：What does the oven tell us?
对人：Who does the teacher ask to be quiet?
对时间：When do we eat dinner?

mistakes.correct: What does the oven tell us?
mistakes.explanation: 特殊疑问句也需要倒装/助动词结构。

examples: What does the oven tell us?
Where do they share their ideas?

grammar.title: 宾语从句的概念：作宾语的“句子”
grammar.definition: 宾语从句就是在句子中充当宾语的从句（做宾语的句子）。常见于tell/know/think/ask等动词后面。
grammar.structure: 主句动词 + (that/wh-) + 从句
usage: He tells us (that) it is ready.
The oven tells us what to do.（也可视为含疑问词的宾语从句结构）

mistakes.wrong: He tells us to that it is ready.
mistakes.correct: He tells us (that) it is ready.
mistakes.explanation: that从句前不加to。

examples: She knows what he wants.
He told me (that) he was busy.

grammar.title: 第三人称单数（三单）：不是“三个单”，是“第三人称 + 单数”
grammar.definition: 三单=第三人称单数（he/she/it/单数名词）；一般现在时动词常加-s/-es。I/you不属于三单。
grammar.structure: he/she/it/单数名词 + 动词-s/-es
usage: He likes... / She goes... / The oven tells...
They like...（复数不加-s）

mistakes.explanation: I是第一人称，不用does。
they是复数，不用三单-s。

examples: The oven tells us the time.
He does his homework every day.

grammar.title: 一般疑问句的核心考点：无be/情态/助动词时用do/does/did
grammar.definition: 改一般疑问句最常考的是：句中没有be动词、情态动词（can等）或助动词（have/has用于完成时）时，必须用do/does/did并把实义动词还原。
grammar.structure: Do/Does/Did + 主语 + 动词原形 + ... ?
usage: 原句动词原形/非三单：用do
原句动词三单-s：用does，且动词去-s变原形
原句动词过去式：用did，且动词变原形

mistakes.explanation: they不是三单，用do。
did后动词必须回原形make。

examples: Do they grow vegetables here?
Does the smart garden grow plants quickly?

grammar.title: 不规则动词发音与拼写：grow / grew / grown
grammar.definition: grow属于不规则动词，过去式grew、过去分词grown；课堂强调读音容易混淆，要区分/ɡrəʊ/与/ɡruː/。
grammar.structure: grow - grew - grown
usage: 一般过去：The tree grew fast last year.
现在完成：The tree has grown taller.

mistakes.explanation: grow是不规则动词，过去式是grew。

examples: He grew up in the countryside.
The kids have grown a lot.

grammar.title: 合并句子：without + 动名词（把一句话名词化）
grammar.definition: 用without合并两句时，without后不能接完整句子；通常把其中一句去主语、去助动词，把动词变V-ing变成名词性短语。
grammar.structure: 主句 + without + V-ing + 宾语/状语
usage: They can cook meals without wasting any food.
He left without saying anything.

mistakes.wrong: They can cook meals without they waste food.
mistakes.correct: They can cook meals without wasting food.
mistakes.explanation: without后不能接“主语+谓语”的完整句，需用V-ing短语。

examples: The smart kitchen cooks meals without wasting food.
She went out without taking an umbrella.

grammar.title: 合并句子：and连接并列分句（主语相同可省略）
grammar.definition: and是连词，可以直接连接两句话；若前后分句主语相同，后一句的主语常可省略以避免重复。
grammar.structure: (主语 + 谓语 + ...) and (省略主语) + 谓语 + ...
usage: They can cook meals, and (they) never waste any food.

mistakes.wrong: They can cook meals and without wasting food.
mistakes.correct: They can cook meals without wasting food. / They can cook meals and never waste food.
mistakes.explanation: and连接分句；without引导介词结构，两种合并方式结构不同。

examples: She opened the door and walked in.
He studied hard and got a good score.

grammar.title: 名词/动词同形与词性判断：volunteer（名词/动词）
grammar.definition: 同一个单词可能既是名词也可作动词；判断词性要看句子成分（主语/谓语位置）。
grammar.structure: volunteer (n.) / volunteer (v.)
usage: 名词：Many volunteers came.
动词：Many students volunteer to help.

mistakes.wrong: Young people in the USA volunteer.（当成名词翻译）
mistakes.correct: 在该句中volunteer是动词：志愿去做……
mistakes.explanation: 主语已有young people，后面出现volunteer更可能是谓语动词。

examples: They volunteer to help others.
The volunteers worked all day.

grammar.title: spend的核心义：花费（时间/金钱）→ 语境决定是否译为“度过”
grammar.definition: spend底层含义是“花费”；当宾语是时间并搭配活动时可译“花时间做……”，不一定都译成“度过”。
grammar.structure: spend + 时间/金钱 + (on sth / doing sth)
usage: spend time doing：spend time helping others
spend money on：spend money on books

mistakes.explanation: spend time后常接doing结构。

examples: He spends two hours reading every day.
She spent a lot of money on the phone.

grammar.title: 名词加e变动词导致读音变化：bath/bathe, breath/breathe
grammar.definition: 部分词对：名词无e，动词加e；读音也随之变化（常见考点）。
grammar.structure: bath (n.) → bathe (v.)；breath (n.) → breathe (v.)
usage: 名词：Take a bath. / Take a deep breath.
动词：He bathed the baby. / Try to breathe slowly.

mistakes.wrong: I will bath now.（想表达动词）
mistakes.explanation: 动词应为bathe而非bath。
动词应为breathe而非breath。

examples: She took a bath and then breathed deeply.
It's important to breathe fresh air.

grammar.title: 阅读题技巧：先读题干，抓名词关键词定位（交叉信息）
grammar.definition: 做阅读时不一定通读全文；先读懂题目，抓题干里稳定的名词关键词（如USA, Alice, summer）去原文定位，信息交叉处通常就是答案区。
grammar.structure: 题干关键词（名词/专有名词/时间地点）→ 原文定位 → 对照选项
usage: 题干：young people in the USA + volunteer + help others → 定位USA/young people/volunteer所在段落
题干：Alice + summer → 同时满足两词的句子附近找答案

mistakes.wrong: 先把整篇文章逐句翻译再做题
mistakes.correct: 先定位关键词再读相关句/段
mistakes.explanation: 考试时间有限，定位法更高效。

examples: Find 'USA' and 'volunteer' in the passage, then read around that part.
Cross-check 'Alice' + 'summer' to locate the exact sentence.

grammar.title: 阅读定位：两条信息交叉定位（交叉点附近就是答案区）
grammar.definition: 题干往往给出两条线索（如人物+时间/地点）；先分别定位两条信息，再找它们在原文中的交叉区域，答案通常在交叉区域附近。
grammar.structure: 线索A定位 + 线索B定位 → 交叉点（同一句/同一段）→ 对照选项
usage: 人物+时间：Alice + summer
人物+行为：young people in the USA + volunteer

mistakes.wrong: 只找到人物就直接选答案
mistakes.correct: 必须同时满足两条线索，找交叉点再选
mistakes.explanation: 题干是“双条件”，只满足一个条件容易选错。

examples: Alice is here, and 'summer' is there—read around where they meet.
USA + young people + volunteer—answers usually appear near that cluster.

grammar.title: 后置定语：修饰名词但放在名词后面（短语/从句都可以）
grammar.definition: 后置定语就是放在名词后面的修饰成分，用来描述名词；常见形式有介词短语后置、定语从句后置。
structure: 名词 + 介词短语：the apple on the tree
名词 + 定语从句：families that are not rich
usage: 当修饰成分较长或是句子时，通常放在名词后面，避免歧义
单个形容词一般前置：a beautiful apple

mistakes.explanation: 介词短语作定语通常后置，前置会造成结构和意义混乱。

examples: the book on the desk
the students who study hard

grammar.title: that的两种常见用法：宾语从句连接词 vs 定语从句关系代词
grammar.definition: that放在句中间可能是：①引导宾语从句的连接词（不作成分）；②引导定语从句的关系代词（指代先行词并在从句中充当成分）。
structure: 动词 + that + 句子：We know that Jason is 18.（宾语从句）
名词 + that + 句子：families that are not rich（定语从句）
usage: 判断方法：看that前面的词——动词更像宾语从句；名词更像定语从句
定语从句中that修饰前面的名词（先行词）

mistakes.wrong: 把所有that都当成同一种用法
mistakes.correct: 先看that前面是名词还是动词，再判断从句类型
mistakes.explanation: 宾语从句与定语从句功能不同，翻译和理解方式也不同。

examples: We believe that he is honest.
The house that they built is cheap.

grammar.title: 定语从句识别：that从句紧跟名词，专门修饰最近的名词
grammar.definition: 定语从句本质是“句子当定语”，通常紧跟被修饰名词；常遵循“就近修饰”，让指代更清晰。
grammar.structure: 名词（先行词） + that/who/which + 从句
usage: families that are not rich：that从句修饰families
the apple that is on the tree：that从句修饰apple

mistakes.wrong: 让一个从句同时修饰两个名词
mistakes.correct: 按就近原则只修饰一个明确的先行词
mistakes.explanation: 修饰对象不明确会造成语义模糊。

examples: Students who work hard get good grades.
People that help others are respected.

grammar.title: 宾语从句识别：that后是一整句，整体作宾语
grammar.definition: 宾语从句是“句子当宾语”，出现在动词后，用来补全“知道/认为/说”的内容。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词（know/think/say/tell等） + that + 从句
usage: We know that Jason is 18.
He said that he would come.

mistakes.explanation: that引导从句，位置应在动词后、从句前。

examples: I think that it is true.
She knows that he is a teacher.

grammar.title: the + 形容词：表示“一类人”（作复数概念）
grammar.definition: the + 形容词可表示某一类人（整体群体），如the rich（富人），the young（年轻人），the old（老人）。
grammar.structure: the + adjective（复数意义）
usage: the rich：富人（群体）
the poor：穷人（群体）

mistakes.explanation: the+形容词表示一类人，常用复数谓语are。

examples: The rich are not always happy.
The young are full of energy.

grammar.title: 双宾语动词：teach + 间接宾语 + 直接宾语
grammar.definition: teach可带两个宾语：教“某人”（间接宾语）+ 教“什么内容”（直接宾语）。对内容提问用what。
grammar.structure: teach + sb + sth / teach + sb + how to do sth
usage: He teaches people how to build houses.
What does he teach people?

mistakes.explanation: 特殊疑问句仍需助动词do/does倒装结构。

examples: She taught us English.
He teaches students how to read.

grammar.title: 翻译技巧：什么时候需要“从后往前翻”
grammar.definition: 当句子里出现介词短语、连词、从句等“增加成分”导致句子变长、难以一眼看懂时，可以先翻译后面的修饰成分（介词短语/从句），再回到主干翻译。
grammar.structure: 先处理修饰成分（介词短语/从句）→ 再翻主干（主谓宾）→ 必要时加“的”连接
usage: 有介词/连词/从句时：先翻修饰成分，再翻主句
句子短且无连接成分时：按正常语序翻译即可

mistakes.wrong: 所有句子都机械从后往前翻
mistakes.correct: 只在句子复杂、修饰成分多时使用从后往前
mistakes.explanation: 短句或纯主谓宾句不需要倒着翻。

examples: Kids with trouble in reading need help.（先翻with...）
He teaches kids.（短句直接翻）

grammar.title: 后置定语是阅读难点的“罪魁祸首”：介词短语后置 + 定语从句后置
grammar.definition: 阅读中大量后置定语会让句子变长、信息堆在名词后面；常见两种：介词短语作后置定语、定语从句作后置定语。
structure: 名词 + 介词短语：the kids in trouble
名词 + 定语从句：kids who have trouble in reading
usage: 看见名词后面跟一长串：先找被修饰的名词，再切分后置部分
先判断后置部分是短语还是句子：短语=介词短语；句子=从句

mistakes.wrong: 把后置定语当成疑问词或主句成分
mistakes.correct: 把后置部分整体当作修饰语，先抓主干
mistakes.explanation: 后置定语只修饰名词，不改变主干主谓宾。

examples: the families in the city
the families that are not rich

grammar.title: that在句中：不要当疑问词，常是连词/关系代词引导从句
grammar.definition: that在句中间通常不是疑问词；要么引导宾语从句（连词），要么引导定语从句（关系代词）。出现that后面往往是一整句。
structure: 动词 + that + 句子（宾语从句）
名词 + that + 句子（定语从句）
usage: 判断关键：that前面是动词→更可能宾语从句；that前面是名词→更可能定语从句
定语从句遵循就近修饰：修饰最近的名词

mistakes.wrong: 把that后面的句子当作主句继续翻
mistakes.correct: 切分：主干 + 从句（修饰/补充内容）
mistakes.explanation: that后面是从句，不是新的并列主句。

examples: We know that he is right.
The kid that has trouble in reading needs help.

grammar.title: 动名词作主语：reading books 是“一件事”，谓语用三单
grammar.definition: 动词加-ing构成动名词/动名词短语，可当名词作主语；即使后面宾语是复数books，整个短语仍视为单数概念，谓语用三单。
grammar.structure: V-ing (短语) + V-s
usage: Reading books makes people better.
Swimming is good for health.

mistakes.explanation: reading books整体作主语=单数，谓语用makes。
主语位置要用名词性形式：动名词reading。

examples: Reading helps you make progress.
Doing exercise improves your health.

grammar.title: 主谓宾骨架：先抓主语，再决定谓语是否三单（不要被books误导）
grammar.definition: 判断谓语是否加-s，关键看主语是什么（读书这件事/书本本身）；同一句汉语可用不同逻辑表达，但要保证主语与谓语一致。
usage: Reading books makes people better.（读书这件事）
Books make people better.（书本带来的作用）

mistakes.explanation: 主语不是books，而是reading books。

examples: Reading English every day makes you better.
Books make us wiser.
